The amendments include changes to contributions made to the Thrift Savings Fund, retired pay exclusions, and effective dates for the amendments. The Executive Director will determine the first election period for making elections consistent with the amendments made by this Act. Definitions include "election period" as a period under title 5, and "Executive Director" as defined in title 5. SEC. 2. ELIGIBLE ROLLOVER DISTRIBUTIONS. Section 8432 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to allow employees or Members to contribute eligible rollover distributions from qualified trusts to the Thrift Savings Fund. The contribution must follow the form described in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, and the maximum amount transferred should not exceed what would have been included in gross income for tax purposes. The Executive Director will create regulations for employees or Members to contribute eligible rollover distributions from qualified trusts to the Thrift Savings Fund for Federal income tax purposes. SEC. 3. IMMEDIATE PARTICIPATION IN THE THRIFT SAVINGS PLAN. The text chunk discusses the elimination of waiting periods for employee contributions to the Thrift Savings Plan. The Executive Director will prescribe regulations to allow employees to make elections promptly upon commencing service. Employees will have the opportunity to make an election under this subsection upon starting their service, or when it becomes administratively feasible. Contributions under subsection (c) will not be payable before the earliest allowable pay period. Section 8432(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to ensure contributions are made in accordance with a program of regular contributions provided in regulations prescribed by the Executive Director. Section 8432 of title 5, United States Code is amended to include provisions related to contributions and elections.
